column4: hullo ubuntu; I have a question: is there anyway I can access the network manager or the GDM manager from a terminal? I just recently got fluxbox, and now can't get back to gnome because the GDM theme i got doesn't have a session changer, for some reason.
that will start the network manager program
doh. I didn't capitalize the N or M when i tried that command before. lol thanks
you mean to change default GDM manager settings?
oh hey. ya, if I could just default the GDM settings from terminal, that'd be great.
i need it to go back to either the default session of xclient, or the default theme human
hmm ok are you attempting to setup the default Gnome desktop from kde?

right now I'm stuck in fluxbox, because I accidentally set it as my default session window manager in the GDM. When I log onto the GDM, I can't change the session back to gnome because the theme I installed doesn't have a session changer; so I would like to change the GDM all the way back to its original default settings
sorry Neo i forgot so many things happening here
it's ok, i guess. lol. I'll just wait
wait, and keep googling that is
I think I found it. sudo dpkg-reconfigure kdm; I just changed it from kdm to gdm
sorry i havent done it in so long im a long time gnome lover
lol, after this; I think I may never leave either
good news, I found the session menu in my theme; I just started mashing all of the buttons until something worked. and it did! so now back in gnome, and off to bed. Thanks for your help!
